review: Ein wunderschön detailreich gezeichnetes Wimmelbild-Spiel mit düsterer Atmosphäre, grafisch sehr ansprechend gestaltet. Die Sounds waren etwas irritierend und teilweise sogar nervig, die musikalische Untermalung hingegen passte gut ins Setting. Was ich persönlich super fand: Die Rätsel sind ziemlich knifflig an manchen Stellen, aber auch nicht konstant so herausfordernd, sodass alles sehr ausgewogen bleibt und man sich weder langweilt noch zu sehr frustriert wird. Die Story als Ganzes ist nichts wirklich Neues und Aufregendes, eben wie der Titel schon sagt ein typisches Szenario, was man mögen muss um es zu spielen. Was etwas ärgerlich war, dass die Steuerung manchmal sehr gehakt hat und man dadurch die Rätsel nicht schnell genug lösen konnte oder so versehentlich vermittelt wurde, dass man die Lösung noch nicht gefunden hätte. Mittendrin ist mir das Spiel auch mal vollständig abgestürzt. Etwas schade, aber am Ende hab ich es nach gut 10 Stunden Spielzeit doch geschafft und empfehle es auch trotz der kleineren technischen Mängel gern weiter an Rätsel-Freund*innen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198307908110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 480, 'last_played': 1706335477}
review:
I was honestly very excited to play this game since I do enjoy playing hidden object games, but this game really leaves me unsure of what to think.  There were some things the game did very well, but there were definitely times where I was very frustrated with it too.

The story was something I thought was done decently enough to really only leave a couple questions behind.  As a writer, I would like the questions to be answered, but they don't really hold any real importance to the plot.  Of course, like any contract one would make with the Devil, there were great boons for the receiver to get but releasing the 7 vices was a way of there being a weakness.  This is a concept I have not seen before, and thought was a great idea.  The seven vices each give you an item to help you in your journey, though I was disheartened to find out they make no further appearance or help in the game after you capture them all.  Not a huge loss though because the story played out very well and didn't feel rushed.

The game itself didn't really have any music that really stood out.  There were background noises that created the ambiance and the noises that came with certain environmental triggers, but I really think adding music to the game or having something playing softly in the background (whether it be warped music for the Mirror World or eerie music for all sections) would add to the magic of playing the game.  I found myself getting irritated by a lot of the noises because they felt repetitious and persisted for longer than they should.  Some noises were also louder than others and there didn't seem to be a great balance between them.  

Now to the actual gameplay, of which there were a lot of things that could have been done better.  One of the first issues I ran into with the game is the lack of a map.  I had assumed at first that I needed to find the map before I could gain use of it, but quickly realized that you get no map.  If there were fewer areas, then I think having no map would be easier to navigate, but with there being so many sections to each chapter of the game, it became very difficult to navigate where each item was or if there was something I could do in a different section. 
The hidden object games were fine, though were a little more difficult than others I had played in the past.  The Similar Objects game where you have to locate two items that were similar to each other was the most difficult of the puzzles.  I honestly had no idea what I was doing the first time I saw this puzzle since the items could be two different things (ex. find two articles of clothing with one being a glove and the other a hat).  I think having more directions for this would be great.  
A couple of the puzzles also straight up didn't function like they should have (the metal puzzle where you have to create an image by rotating and swapping metal pieces to create a picture).  This puzzle in particular was structured exactly like the picture, but only a few of the tiles were lit up and in the "right place".  I closed out of the game a couple of times only for this issue to persist, and it only "fixed" itself after I had rotated the other pieces to a direction that made no sense and have it right itself out.  If the puzzle is going to have different functions attached to it, at least make sure the puzzle pieces are properly oriented to make use of those functions, not be half completed.  
And to top it all off, the game crashed itself a couple times while I was playing the game.  Sure, any game could crash at any given point, but I found it frustrating after the issues I've already come in contact with.  I'm not the only one that has had issues with the game crashing either.  

As much as I loved the story for this game, it wasn't executed as well as it could have been and could benefit from having a few quality of life updates.  It's very rare for me to dislike a game, but unfortunately a good story couldn't fix the other issues this game had.  This is a game I unfortunately wouldn't recommend.  Play at your own risk, but this is by far the most difficult hidden object game I have played and I didn't find it nearly as fun as I had others.

review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand—the hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed—the hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥ minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

review:
La tradicional aventura Point & Click de ambientacion semi misteriosa, el lore basico, nada del otro mundo, es el relleno que nos sirve de base para amalgamar todos los puzzles y escenarios en los que te vas a desenvolver. Aca la tematica en este caso es que es como que secuestran a alguien por 1 espejo magico o algo asi y vos pactas como con el demonio y luego al final lo terminas venciendo.
Jugabilidad bien, puzzles interesantes, dura masomenos 4 horas, tiene las pistas que te sirven para momentos de ayuda o necesidad apremiante, pero este juego es de la linea Big Fish/8 Floor asi que en esencia no hay mucho mas que decir.

Logros y cromos suman valor al titulo el cual lamentablemente no tiene el idioma español. Quiero destacar que los graficos son Muy lindos, estan muy bien logrados, hay escenarios de la mansion y del final que son realmente entrañables porque entablan bien esa suerte de atmosfera de terror de algo que en otro contexto podriamos considerar generico, decadente o casual. La musica muy bien, al igual que los sonidos, excelente repertorio.

No hay doblaje y algunas otras cosas como siempre en este tipo de juegos son posibles de añadir a la critica.
No obstante considero que el juego esta por arriba del promedio asi que sin dudas te guste o no el género, merece que le des una chance.
8.5/10 - No es un juego memorable, pero te entretiene bastante bien.

При первом прохождении игра вылетела 5 раз, причём именно в моменты решения головоломок. Ближе к концу начала зависать и переставала грузиться при переходе между локациями замка (экран гас, курсор горел, но новый зал не прогружался, пока окно не свернёшь или игру не вырубишь).

Сплошное разочарование и раздражение.
А ещё в этой игре раздражало отсутствие карты.

review:
Don't judge a book by it's cover with this one. The story starts very quickly and before you know it you're into your first hidden object scene. There is no voice acting, which is a little jarring at first compared to HOG's these days but if you can read fast it's alright. Where this game is a hidden gem are the puzzles - varied and sometimes difficult (don't touch that skip button). The hidden objects scenes are good, albeit a little extra difficult due to the age of the game. The best ones are finding logical pairs which you don't see too often in HOG's. The story gets more interesting as the game goes along and ends fairly abruptly but the length is just about right. Achievements are attainable but just don't skip or use hints.
Overall, a little rough around the edges but ultimately enertaining

review:
You've been invited by a lord about something important concerning your daughter Lisa. However, she is kidnapped by a strange figure. You don't have a choice but track down the being in the Mirror World.

The plot has potential. I mean, tracking down the seven deadly sins is a nice storyline. However, I feel like there are some timeline problems: the starting point is 1853 and the story is taken place into the present and should 200 years later. But nothing screams 2053. Nothing screams 'we're in a contemporary world' apart the outfit of the protagonist and some cutscenes.

The gameplay is classic for that kind of games: find items to use, find objects in hidden objects scenes or logical pairs, solve minigames. This is where the game fails the most: some minigames are very hard and can take long to solve. Sometimes, the description of what you have to do is not even precise enough, result: you're lost. And I don't speak about the find logical pairs, because some of the logical pairs aren't logical at all. The hidden objects scenes are not easy for some items to find too. And I don't speak about finding your ways: each time I've started a new section, I was stuck quickly and I took so much time to find my way - because this stubborn girl doesn't want to use hints though at the end, I was so fed up that I used them (not in the hidden object scenes).

The worst is the number of times the game crashed or closed itself. I would say that I'm at a count of five. Meh, it even crashed in the middle of an hard minigame...

Graphically, it's correct, soundtrack is OK, no real voice acting apart for the seven sins and it's gibberish.

Avoid this title unless you're an hardcore fan of the genre or if you're an achievement hunter.

review:
Уже с первых секунд после запуска этой игры у меня стали закрадываться подозрения, что игра полнейшая шляпа, так оно и оказалось. Удивило, что нельзя сразу начать или продолжить игру, каждый раз приходится ждать секунд 10 пока не воспроизведется дурацкая анимация в главном меню. Какой "гений" решил, что это круто и пойдет на пользу игре? Все загадки и головоломки в основном нудные, не логичные и сильно различаются по сложности. То есть уже в самом начале было несколько довольно трудных задачек, а в середине и в конце много совершенно легчайших, что странно, т.к. в норме сложность должна нарастать по мере прохождения, а не быть случайной. Задача с циферблатом на часах не хило подпалила седалище..Так же была замечена явная ошибка в одной из сцен поиска предметов - игра указывала, что нужно найти болт, хотя на самом деле гайку, как оказалось. В этой игре какая-то странная локализация, хотя судя по титрам она сделана российскими разработчиками и проблем с этим не должно было быть. Или еще пример - нужно было починить сломанную пластинку, в описании всплывала подсказка, что ее можно починить клеем, тыкаю на нее этим самым клеем, но он не срабатывает, пхах. По "гениальной" логике разрабов сначала нужно было поставить банку с клеем на никак не обозначенную область рядом с пластинкой (играл на "хардкоре" если что, без подсвеченных областей).. И таких примеров тут куча, по сути из подобной бредятины и состоит вся игра. Но самое забавное, что если в процессе поиска предметов нажать на кнопку Esc, то головоломка моментально пропускается и считается решенной. Хотя во всех уважающих себя играх Esc отвечает за вызов меню, паузу и возможность выйти из игры.. При этом я собирался с первого раза пройти игру на все ачивки, т.е. играть без использования подсказок и пропусков головоломок, но случайное нажатие Ecs всё испортило.. После всего этого назвать разработчиков данной поделки кроме как чудаками на букву м не получится. Так же раздражает, что курсор в игре меняет свой внешний вид, становится большим и неудобным. Благо в настройках есть опция сделать его стандартного размера, но это приходится делать каждый раз при новом заходе в игру, автоматически запомнить эту простейшую настройку игра видимо не в состоянии..
Под конец вообще какой-то треш и абсурд начался, эта игра упорно не хочет заканчиваться и гоняет игрока от одной локации в другую и обратно. Тем более там приходится ездить на лифте и из-за этого надо постоянно ждать его анимацию.. При очередной смене главы думаешь: "Ну может уже сейчас наконец-то эта чертова игра закончится!?" Но нет, она упорно подбрасывает тебе новой головной боли в виде надоедливых головоломок и не думает кончаться...Так же в процессе было несколько вылетов на раб.стол, что способствует еще большему возгоранию пятой точки. Ужасная игра.
Не рекомендую к покупке, не тратьте свое время и нервы. Худшая игра в жанре "поиск предметов", которую я только видел. Прошел ее исключительно ради принципа, никакого удовольствия не получил.

review:
Wimmelbildspiel, im klassischen Stil von BigFishgames und Co.

review:
VERY TENTATIVE RECOMMENDATION.

From start to finish, the game is around four or five hours without hints and at $5 full price, it's a bargain. (There are bundles to save, and sometimes on sale.) There's only one or two words that don't quite match up: "pipe" for a clarinet is one. The story is a bit lame but that's to be expected from a HOG.

There is some problems with two achievements (use no hints), but they can be obtained through cheesing the game at the beginning, or by a very specific delete method. There are two more achievements (HO speed) that can give a little trouble but they can be cheesed.

The game has a problem with speed of clicking things that can cause it to crash. The loss of progress is usually very minimal. But there is one at the end of the 5th act (the envy / hankerchief) section. If you wait for animations to fully complete before clicking on things, then the crash will never happen to you. The envy section has a little bit longer animation, but if you click anything during the animation you run VERY high risk of crashing your game AND corrupting the playthrough with a soft lock.

If you play the game knowing this information going in, you'll complete it in 4-6 hours and if you used hints, add 3-4 hours for a second play. It's fairly priced for its quality, but it's not really a memorable game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201246082', 'num_games_owned': 3232, 'num_reviews': 1500, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1655849761}
review:
Contract With The Devil, mistisizm ve gerçekliği birleştiren heyecan verici bir macera oyunudur. Oyun, bilinmeyen bir göndericiden gelen ve kızınızla ilgili önemli bir sırrı açıklamak için sizi evine davet eden bir mektupla başlar. Ancak, malikanenin sahibiyle akşam yemeği sırasında kızınız Lisa gizemli bir şekilde kötü bir güç tarafından alınır ve antika bir aynanın içinde kaybolur.

Amacınız, Sonya'nın kendisini ve kızını kurtarmasına yardımcı olmak için yedi mengeneyi Kasaya geri döndürmek ve bulmacaları ve bilmeceleri çözmektir. Mistisizmle dolu bu tehlikeli yolculukta yolunuzu bulmak için sadık yardımcınız Brownie'nin ipuçlarını kullanmanız gerekecek.

Oyunda heyecan verici görevler, sıra dışı bilmeceler ve eşya ve önemli eserlerin aranması da dahil olmak üzere çok sayıda mantık bulmacası yer alıyor. Ayrıca aynanın içinden geçip geçmişi ziyaret edecek, uğursuz aile sırlarını keşfedecek ve kötülüğün gücüne meydan okuyacaksınız.

Hedefinize ne kadar yaklaşırsanız, birilerinin ondan o kadar hoşlanmayacağı konusunda uyarın. Gizem, macera ve doğaüstü unsurları bir araya getiren Contract With The Devil, heyecan verici bir oyun deneyimi sunuyor.

review:
Rather low-effort HOG (Hidden Objects Game) game, but it has its charm. 

The story begins with our protagonist Sonya receiving a letter from a guy she knows from somewhere...? I dunno, but as it turns out, the guy sold his soul to the Devil (yeah, it's written on the contract that everyone can read) and needs the soul of an innocent child to pay the fees. Thus, he kidnaps Sonya's adopted daughter and intends to conduct some ritual on her. And here begins Sonya's quest to save not only her daughter, but her friend's lost soul. Quite an interesting concept if you ask me, but it's a HOG game, it's not very complex. We just need an excuse for mini-games/puzzles and HOG scenes. 

There's a lot of those, and I like most of them, they are also not very complex. Quite a standard collection of puzzles that you have seen in countless point and click games before. But they pretty much fit into the game's world. When I think of dealing with the devil, I think of a lot of children's puzzles to unravel the truth (or a lie for that matter). 

Graphically, it's also standard HOG. I don't know, is there some sort of basic creator for this kind of graphics, or is it just an army of graphics designers all trained in this one style? They sell their stuff to any hidden objects game company out there or something? I wouldn't tell if it's another Artifex Mundi game, but animations are quite minimalistic (even compared to the most minimalistic Artifex Mundi game), and there is no voice acting. So the overall impression is that this is a very low budget (and low effort) game. However, as I said, it is competent in telling the story and integrating it with the collection of puzzles. 

I decided to give it a Yes rating. If you like HOG games, it's a quite fun break between better adventure games out there.

review:
[i]Native resolution: 1024 x 768, a 4:3 aspect ratio[/i]

I'm going to recommend this game to hidden object adventure game veterans in particular because Contract With the Devil is [i]tough.[/i]

Some of the puzzles and most of the hidden object scenes slapped me around and made me feel like I was putting in the same amount of effort as I would for a full-scale adventure game.

This is a mostly well-made hidden object adventure game, but it's old and felt clunky until I got used to its quirks.  The paper doll puppet tool animations in cutscenes are low-quality and create disturbing character movements.  The game's only voice acting are basic vocalizations and distorted demonic voices.  Cutscene dialog is only text and sometimes auto-advances too quickly to read.  However, the art and particle effects are really nice, despite this ancient game being low resolution and not supporting widescreen.

There were many puzzles I have never seen before in my life, which was very pleasing to me.  On the other hand, I was not pleased by how many of my least-favorite type of puzzles there were: where changing one thing changes multiple other things.  I will always hate those kinds of puzzles.  I think since learning a bit of the technique for sliding tile puzzles, I'd rather play those!  (There aren't any sliding tiles in CWtD.)

Hidden object scenes were downright dastardly!  Objects are hidden in absolutely insane ways.  Even the scenes in the very first area are brutal.  This is the first HOAG I've played with "logical pairs" hidden object scenes, and let me tell you some of them were a leap of logic.

There's an achievement for completing a hidden object scene in less than 1 minute.  This is the only achievement I didn't get in my playthrough.  These scenes are so difficult, I believe it's impossible to do it that fast unless you already know where the objects are.  I didn't want to leave this one achievement unachieved, so I started a new game to hopefully learn the first hidden object scene.

I stumbled upon an exploit for this achievement: I used Alt+F4 before clicking the last object in the second hidden object scene (the dining room cabinet), hoping it would have reset when I reloaded the game.  Unfortunately, it did not reset and all objects except one were complete.  Fortunately, the scene [i]timer[/i] had reset and I was given the achievement just for clicking the last object.

This is an exploit but I don't mind accidentally using it and I don't mind sharing it for others to purposely use it.  These scenes cannot be legitimately completed in less than 60 seconds without repeatedly learning the scenes.  Though somehow more people have this achievement (6.4%) than have completed all hidden object scenes without hints (5.2%), so maybe it is possible...

CWtD is a great game if you want a challenge and can overlook the somewhat sloppy manner in which it has aged.

review:
O desconhecido lhe envia uma carta e o convida para sua casa, prometendo contar algo muito importante sobre sua filha. Mas durante o jantar com o dono da mansão, aconteceu o terrível: assim que você jogou fora o cobertor do espelho antigo, uma força misteriosa do mal roubou sua única filha Lisa!

Bem diante de seus olhos, ela desapareceu dentro de um grande espelho sem deixar vestígios, e a única testemunha desses estranhos eventos que poderia lançar a luz - desapareceu. Devolva 7 vícios de volta ao Vault para ajudar Sonya a salvar você e sua filha. Use as pontas de um brownie bogy - ele se tornará seu fiel assistente nesta jornada perigosa cheia de misticismo.

Tarefas emocionantes, enigmas incomuns, muitos quebra-cabeças lógicos, busca de itens e artefatos importantes estão esperando por você. E também, a viagem através do espelho e uma visita ao passado.

Descubra o sinistro segredo de família e lance um desafio ao poder do mal! Mas tenha cuidado, quanto mais perto você estiver do objetivo, mais alguém não gostará muito dele.

review:
I got this with a coupon so it was cheap, but I can't recommend this game because of how buggy it is.  

It crashed for me all the time and I'd get frequent black screens.  One of the achievements bugged out on me as well because of the constant crashing.  

The puzzles themselves are decent and I like the art, but animations are slooow and there are unneeded cut scenes.  For example, I'm not sure why it takes so long to be able to click the "play" button on the main screen and why they needed to show an animation of traveling back and forth across a lake.  

I guess if you can stomach the technical problems this might be an ok hidden object game for you, but there are much more polished ones out there.

review:
[h1] ДУМАЙ, ЧТО ПОДПИСЫВАЕШЬ [/h1]

[code] [b] Contract With The Devil [/b] - квест-головоломка от студии AZ-Art Development Studio. Издателем выступает небезызвестная 8Floor. Игра вышла в Steam в декабре 2015 года и на данный момент имеет всего 109 отзывов, из которых лишь 68% положительных, что в сумме дает "Смешанный" рейтинг. Мне игра понравилась, и я попробую подробнее рассказать, почему. [/code]

[u] [b] ๑۩۩๑ СЮЖЕТ ๑۩۩๑ [/b] [/u]

Соня - мать-одиночка, воспитывающая приемную дочь Лизу. Она мало что знает о своем ребенке, однако очень хотела бы узнать больше. Этим решает воспользоваться таинственный незнакомец, во время встречи с которым Соня получает приглашение посетить старинный особняк. Неизвестный мужчина уверяет, что у него есть сведения, которые обязательно прольют свет на историю Лизы и её знатной семьи. Ну и как тут устоять-то? У незнакомца лишь одно условие - Соня должна прийти вместе с дочуркой, но это, как Вы понимаете, Соню совершенно не смущает и не останавливает. Ну а дальше как по канонам жанра - во время заветной встречи девочку похищает неизвестное злобное зло, а в маме просыпается русская баба, готовая остановить на скаку слона и оторвать ему все, что сильно торчит. 

Вообще, когда имеешь за плечами уже несколько десятков пройденных игр подобного плана, начинаешь замечать убийственную закономерность, которую уже действительно в пору назвать каноном. Так вот "каноны" Contract with the Devil собрала все - здесь вам и всесильная девушка-ГГ, и похищенный ребенок, и злобное зло, которое строит безумные но никому не непонятные жуткие козни, а встретившись с ГГ отлетает с полпинка. В общем, все как доктор прописал. Но давайте обо всем по-порядку. 

[u] [b] ๑۩۩๑ ГЕЙМПЛЕЙ ๑۩۩๑ [/b] [/u]

В рамках Contract With The Devil нас ждет вполне себе стандартное приключение с элементами hidden objects: ищем предметы, засовываем в нужные места, проходим дальше. Периодически жизнь будут осложнять разные головоломки на подбор правильных цветов/чисел/элементов и прочей мишуры, а также сцены с "разбором хлама". Изюминкой данного приключения для меня оказались задачи на поиск логических пар - эдакая альтернатива разбросанным предметам, только вместо поиска конкретных вещей по списку вам предстоит подбирать пары предметов, каким-то образом логически связанных между собой. Логика, правда, временами будет весьма своеобразной, но сама задумка для меня оказалась достаточно свежей и приятно разбавила все то, к чему успел привыкнуть в прочих играх. 

А вот от чего в Contract With The Devil испытываешь самое подлинное удовольствие, так это от красивейших фонов, очень бережно и атмосферно отрисованных художниками. На них хочется просто любоваться, подолгу оставаясь в этой одновременно мрачной но уютной реальности. Музыкальное сопровождение здесь ненавязчивое, никаких нареканий не вызывает. Имеется несколько режимов сложности, возможность пропустить наиболее сложные или по каким-то причинам не особо интересные головоломки. Русская локализация тоже на уровне, без косяков. Имеется также набор достижений, большую часть которых можно выбить достаточно легко, правда за парочкой последних придется попотеть. Одним словом - все, как по списку. 

[u] [b] ๑۩۩๑ СТОИТ ЛИ ИГРАТЬ? ๑۩۩๑ [/b] [/u]

На полное прохождение Contract With The Devil у меня ушло чуть более восьми часов игрового времени с учетом того, что в определенный момент был сделан длительный перерыв в игре. Думается, при желании игру можно пройти быстрее, но вот тут как раз тот случай, когда даже при самых умелых руках и голове за пару часов никак не управиться, да и, честно говоря, если проникнетесь игрой, большого желания куда-то сильно спешить у Вас не возникнет. Ценник у "Контракта" достаточно умеренный, однако имеет смысл дождаться скидки - от 50% игра появляется в Steam достаточно часто.

review:
Intensive long-play. I really like the female protagonist.  I hope they use her again!  I believe the developers used a great amount of time, skill, labor, and talent to make this game.   Maybe they'll make a sequel without the dark side.

It's about a selfish man who took her daughter so he could live another 200 years as rich, successful, and powerful. He foolishly signed a contract with the devil.  The mom races to rescue her child who is sucked through a mirror. She has to recapture 7 demons (lust, greed, deceit, laziness, etc.) I never got bored.

HOG's are a variety of hidden objects, matching objects that go together (bunny slippers + carrot), and performing actions (putting matches on a candle) so you can earn useful objects in the game. 

Pros:
-hint button for most brain teasers
-Journal that writes down your clues. You may still have to do the math and figure out patterns & sequences yourself. You will use a lot of logic and reasoning skills.
-Emphasizes family and love over fear.
-I don't recall any swearing.
-Actions are not all about making potions & magic, although there are some throughout.  You do mechanical
things, and lots of logical tasks.
- The game gives you a group of scenes  at a time for you to do before leveling you up.  So no walking back 50 locations to do something.  
- Lots of locations and activities makes it feel more like an adventure game than a HOG, which I like.

Cons:
- satanic rituals to perform, Ouija board, and lots of occultic symbolism. 
- May not be appropriate for kids with all the occult images, demon statues, carving and art everywhere.  People flop over dead a couple of times. A child is screaming & crying as she is being carried away by a figure in black.
- conjuring demons
- oppressive atmosphere
- Some imagery is actually scary or intimidating.
- Using evil to defeat evil.
-everytime I restarted the game, I had to "sign a contract with the devil" to play.

review:
Противоречивые чувства после этой игры.

Плюсы:
1. Игра длиннее обычных игр из жанра "Я ищу".
2. Головоломки не самые затасканные и относительно сложные.
3. Сцены поиска предметов тоже не самые простые. Надо тщательно искать.

Минусы:
1. Игра длиннее обычных игр из жанра "Я ищу" за счёт очень долгих анимаций. В сценах поиска предметов, в кат-сценах, да вообще везде. Включая беготню между локациями в отсутствии фаст тревела. Ещё и подгрузки между главами. Да что там, чтобы начать игру, надо ждать очень долго, пока пройдёт анимация на кнопке "Играть". Да где вы вообще видели, чтобы вас не пускали поскорее в игру? А как вам сами собой пропадающие записки, которые не успел прочитать и надо заходить в журнал? А там этот текст ещё мельче.
2. Некоторые головоломки решаются просто поочерёдным нажатием на все кнопки.
3. Сцены поиска предметов по большей части сложны тем, что всё тусклое, обесцвеченное. Пойди найди что-то, когда все предметы сливаются с фоном.
4. Не знаю, по какой причине, но игра идёт в разрешении 4:3, без растягивания - справа и слева будут чёрные полосы. Я не знаю, в каком году сделали игру, но это бесчеловечно так поступать в любом случае.
5. Сюжет трогать не буду - он тут как в порно, нужен просто для галочки. Да и во всех играх жанра "Я ищу" такая ситуация.

Если и будете покупать - делайте это по скидке, но не запускайте игру. А если запустили, то могу пожелать вам только терпения. Всё остальное тут не нужно.

review:
This genre of games is good from time to time.
It's casual, relaxing and it can also be quite fun.
Well, I played a couple of hidden object games.
Some of them were good, others quite horrible.
This one sits somewhere in the middle, I guess.
To be honest: It does not feel polished enough.
Certain 'gameplay elements' were a bit clunky.
It feels quite buggy most of the time, so yeah.
Even the story seemed to be underwhelming.
And overall: It just does not feel fun to play it.
It just honestly lacks a ton of standard things.
It's sort of a half-baked project if you ask me.
Steam has hundreds of hidden object games.
Most of them are straight up better than this.
This game just isn't good enough in my eyes.
Definitely not good enough for a nice review.
With the default price of 4,99€, It feels weak.
I wish steam allowed 'neutral' reviews in here.
A negative review simply feels like an overkill.
But yeah.. I simply can't give it a positive one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102038554', 'num_games_owned': 762, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 488, 'last_played': 1627866234}
review:
Contract With The Devil - это проект с интересными художественными идеями и многообещающим игровым процессом, представляющий вам 8 часов честного игрового процесса + достижения и карточки. Что еще огромный плюс - это самостоятельная часть и ненужно искать продолжение.

Наша главная героиня - мать-одиночка по имени Соня. Она получает письмо от странного джентльмена, в котором её
приглашают в особняк, чтобы поделиться важной информацией о её дочери Лизе. Приняв это странное приглашение, гг оказалась в путана опасное приключение, где ей предстоит узнать зловещее прошлое семьи Макгроу и причины похищения Джоном её дочери.

Скорость текста в повествовании контролировать невозможно, что может привести к пропуску некоторых сюжетных диалогов. 
И здесь на сцену выходит лучшее, что я видела в подобных играх - ДНЕВНИК! Наконец-то это полезный документ, помощник в игре, путеводная звезда. В дневнике действительно записана вся важная информация, его интересно читать и удобно использовать. Если хочется самому себе усложнить игру по максимуму, то отключаем все подсказки, гномом не пользуемся и ничего не пропускаем, тогда вы точно убедитесь насколько хорош дневник в этой игре по сравнению с другими в играх подобного жанра. 

Карты в игре нет, но игра делится на небольшие главы с несколькими локациями, потеряться будет сложно, как и пройти некоторые головоломки. Я вообще удивлена, что я всю игру прошла без пропусков. Головоломок реально очень много и они всюду, ты шкаф боишься открывать, зная что игре мало того, что ты с огромным трудом добыл ключ и информацию, она хочет прокачать твой интеллект до 200, и она его прокачает. В какой-то момент я решала головоломки, не понимая как я это сделала, они просто собирались под кликом моей мышки. До сих пор думаю, как правильно нужно было собирать головоломку с черепами на люке, почему она засчиталась пройденной? 

Соглашусь со многими, самым нудным в игре, оказался поиск предметов по парам. На экране их реально много, что кликабельно ты не знаешь, за ошибку получай туман в лицо и жди возможности продолжить играть. Некоторые предметы спрятаны максимально по м***чески. Например: Листик с картины, почти возле шапки гнома и заметила я его, когда впервые подумала сдаться, соты в виде плитки на стене и т.п. 

В такие игры играют не из-за сюжета, хотя общая атмосфера важна и для чего все это делается, а из-за как раз этих головоломок.  Поэтому нет смысла в подобное играть, если тебе не нравятся головоломки. Они основной механизм игры. И да, для этого жанра нормально использовать упоротые вещи для прохождения дальше или после первого применения выкидывать полезные предметы, как: нож, ножницы, монтировка. Такие миры создают чокнутые механики, запихивающие механизмы в любые предметы мебели и не только, открывающие странными брошками, плитками и т.п. Условности мира, которые любители поисков предметов приняли.

review:
Not the best point and click game I've played, by a long run. I bought it as part of a bundle, so it didn't cost me much, and that's as well. The mini-games are often deliberately obtuse, with pointless twists just to make them difficult to play. If they aren't like that, then the rest are often very samey.
The story, if you play for the story, is nonsense, but that's not necessarily game-ruining.
It's not really an abominable game. When you get going, the puzzles are quite fun and it has all the usual elements of the genre. However it just feels clunky and poor. You can get better games at a similar price. It kills a couple of hours, but you won't think back fondly.

review: Hooo boy. Okay. So, this game has a lot of potential. The idea is cool and the imagery and music are both good. However, some of the hidden object games have very small sections where you can click on the objects, which has led me to not think an object is the right thing if I don't know for sure what something is. The other search puzzles simply say to pair logical items...without telling you anything about any types of items or the ways they might be paired. Farmers hat plus shovel? No! Farmer's hat plus rake? Sure! The mini-games have either gratingly slow mechanics and make strange and unsettling noises or are able to be solved in less than a minute with no in-between. I wouldn't recommend paying full price for it but if you can get it in a set, go wild, I guess.

review: Look, this isn't a terrible game. It's cheap, functional, and it has a lot of content (8-10 hours on average, about twice the length of a typical hidden object game). I just found it more tedious than fun to play -- the artwork is mediocre, the interface is wonky, the "logical pairs" puzzles are a pain, and I had to spam the hint button constantly to find out what to do next. If you want to spend a dollar on sale to get a slightly less-than-average HOG that will keep you occupied for a week of evenings, it's fine for that purpose. However if your time is limited, don't bother with this one because there are far better HOGs out there.

Hidden Object Game, object finding is a little hard on the eyes but overall ok, the story is some dude steals your adopted child who turns out to be the last descendant of the dude's family. He's made a deal with the devil and intends to sacrifice the kid to live for another 200 years and retain his magic powers.

Along the way you capture his demons (gremlin-like representations of some of the capital sins) and solve a bunch of puzzles to progress. Puzzles are ok, nothing too hard although some can be frustrating in the number of steps required to solve them. Lasts for about 3-4 hours and tbh I was done with it by around the 3rd hour mark, but pushed forward just to see it to completion.

Could be better there's some cutscenes, no voice acting whatsoever and the only cutscene I liked was the one with the villain's closeup, that one looked very detailed and well done. Other than that I guess I'd recommend to HOG fans, but not my first choice for the genre. Ok and decent, I've seen worse for sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198893329311', 'num_games_owned': 793, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1116, 'last_played': 1595798743}
review:
AT A GLANCE:
     2/5 Stars - This game could have been great! I do still recommend it but with a caution attached. While playing, I had two technical issues which I have explained in detail below. To be fair, they could just be "out of the ordinary" type of issues. I really like this game and would have given a rating of 4/5 stars, but I took one star off for the two technical issues I had, and took another star off for the games cut scenes and dialogues that moved way to quick for me. Neither of these things are reason enough for me to not recommend this game. 

GAME GENRE:
     Single Player, Hidden Object, Point n Click, Puzzle, Casual, Mystery, Female Protagonist

GAME DESCRIPTION:
     Release Date: Dec. 2015 - You play the game as Sonya trying to find your daughter. Traveling from place to place through mirrors, solving puzzles, and gathering info about the past. Discover the truth about the "Contract with the Devil."

KID FRIENDLY:
     (First know that I am very strict on kid approved material. A game with a standard rating of "PG" I might rate "PG-13". These are my ratings and have nothing to do with standard ratings)

     I rate this "PG-13" with thoughts of moving it to "R" for kids sake. Beware of some spooky images, and the referencing of having a contract with the devil. All of which might be too much for some kids. 

ACHIEVEMENTS:
     19 Achievements ranging from easy to moderate to obtain.

TRADING CARDS:
     7 Trading cards

PROS:
     -Interesting and fun
     -Great job chaining puzzles together
     -The storyline was good (what I caught of it)
     -Plenty of good puzzles

CONS:
     -A few times in the game some voices speak computerized jibberish
     -Within some puzzles there are a few "logical pairs" that don't make sense
     -There is a few hidden objects vs their written description which are wrong
     -Scenes go by too fast to read and watch what is going on
     -A couple technical issues with the game (see "Problems/Issues")

GAMEPLAY:
     Gameplay is good. My only issue would be that you can't quickly click on the hidden objects one right after another because the game likes to celebrate you finding an object. But I think this is how a lot of hidden object games are. I just happened to notice it more in this game than others.

VISUAL EFFECTS:
     Good clean graphics.

AUDIO:
     Some voices are jibberish talk and sound computerized, but I only heard it a few times throughout the game. Nothing that would ruin the games experience. Music and other audio sounds are good.

STORYLINE:
     Pretty interesting storyline, but I wish I caught more of it. You can not control moving on to the next dialogue box, the game does it for you. Unfortunately, the dialogue throughout the whole game moves pretty quick. With fast dialogue boxes during cut scenes you basically have no chance on reading and watching what is going on.

REPLAY VALUE:
     Replay value is good. I might tackle this game again later to piece together the things I missed.

PROBLEMS/ISSUES:
     No problems installing the game, or starting the game up. I did have two technical issues though. The first one was about halfway through when I received an error message while trying to complete a puzzle (locs_text_5_6_1_06). I could not figure out why this happened or even how to fix it, so I had no choice but to create another account and start the game over. During my second time through the game is when I had the other technical issue. Around 3/4 of the way through I received a runtime error message and the game ended up quitting on it's own. I started the game back up, and had no issues after that. I do still recommend this game only because these issues seem out of the ordinary to me.

WORDS FOR DEVELOPERS:
     So much potential with this game. If only you allowed the viewer to move through the story at their own pace instead of forcing the dialogue and cut scenes to push through so quickly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198845717264', 'num_games_owned': 366, 'num_reviews': 196, 'playtime_forever': 854, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 854, 'last_played': 1589935303}
review:
I’d probably go with a mixed review if I could. The game was okay for the most part, but there were some drawbacks. I’ll go with a thumbs up because I liked the puzzle with logical pairs.

This is a hidden object game (HOG) with an unusual feature. Some hidden object puzzles do not give you a list of objects to find. Instead you have to find a number of logical pairs, two items that are connected. For example, a hammer and a nail. If you click on the hammer, the hammer will be highlighted. If you then click on the nail, you made a match and both the hammer and the nail will vanish. If you find the hammer, but not the nail, then the hammer just stays there. So, the challenge is not just to find hidden objects, but to figure out what might be a match. I thought that was a good change of pace.

The story isn’t too bad, but the text sometimes went by too quickly. I think most of the puzzles were reasonable, but for some items, the hitboxes were too small. I’m not a big fan of “find the hotspot”. Also, this game does not have a built-in map. Once you’ve played a few games with an interactive map, it just seems like an obvious feature to have and it’s disappointing when not available.

There were some glitches when running this game and it actually crashed once, but I was able to finish it. I was able to get all the achievements, but some people have had problems such that they needed to uninstall the game and clear out the registry in order to get a couple of achievements. This game is no longer supported by the developers, so don’t expect any bugs to be fixed.

review:
We played lots of HO games because my wife loves them. "Contract with the Devil" is not perfect, but we found it to be one of the best:
- It his not too short (11 h in our case, taken lazily).
- It is well drawn.
- The 'little demons quests' idea is at least a bit more original than the average HO game. 
- HO scenes are challenging, in a good way.
- Some puzzles are not trivial (sometimes perhaps too much; I confess we skipped two of them).
- There are interesting variations on the HO theme.
On the negative side, there seems to be no map to indicate where actions are allowed, so it can be sometimes frustrating.

review: Let me preface this with this was not a badly designed game by any means and there were definitely points in the game that I rather enjoyed. With that out of the way, I was incredibly disappointed with this game in the long run. The first problem is there is zero replay ability, now that isn't the fault of the developers or anything as some games are just made to be played one time, but I kind of thought there might be a new game plus mode or something. The cinematic scenes are rather bland and the story is a bit dry and predictable, but the game play is what probably frustrated me the most. The hidden object portion of the game was fairly standard, but there are some pieces which you have to create in order to click on. Usually that would create a fun challenge like it does in other hidden object games! In this case their interactive objects were so easy to find the only difference between creating the object and clicking one already made was literally 2 clicks and common sense so readily available that a toddler could probably figure it out. Need a lit candle? Well it just so happens to be a box of matches right next to the unlit candle... But as hidden object mini games go, it was fairly standard and more or less what I expected. What I didn't expect was the incredible amount of crashes. In my play through of this game, which I played it a couple of times to see if I had missed anything (I didn't) I crashed probably 6 or 7 times and had to redo entire puzzles because of it. There was one game that stood out to me, it was a find the logical pairs game and I must say, they did really well with this! You have to find X number of logical pairs and that's all the information you have, it was fun, interesting, challenging, and I liked that you weren't given an item list, you had to use intuition. Thumbs up for this puzzle! The cursor in the game is rather huge and for some reason the oddest specificity in where you click is required in the weirdest of places. You have to put all the ingredients on the table, but the last item just won't go down? Well that is because you are approximately five pixels away from where they want you to click the table. I ran into this on multiple occasions, I got so confused sometimes I had to click the hint which literally highlighted the exact area I clicked. The music gets mind numbing enough to make you wonder if your brain is leaking through out your ears, but I've definitely heard worse soundtracks, so this is a fairly meh point for the game. It's not making you want to throw you speakers out the window, but you are probably not going to jump for joy when generic soundtrack part II loops for the eighteenth time. I had multiple puzzles break on me and forced me to restart my game, I had locations break on me on two separate occasions which left me staring at a black screen and yet another restart and if you were expecting a twist, shock of shocks, you will be incredibly disappointed. After the first five minutes of this game you should be able to give an accurate synopsis to whatever person you wish to bore to tears of the entire game! At least they are transparent? I feel I should also mention that there is literally next to no penalty for just spam clicking as well. You get a very very minor tap on the wrist when the game puts up a fog of no clicky anymore for about 2 seconds and that is literally it. No timers, nothing that adds any pressure to any of the mini games so feel free to take all the time in the universe because for some of the more convoluted puzzles, you might actually need that much time. Seriously, some of the mini games are just tedious and have no rhyme or reason for how they work, I think two of them were literally a guessing game for me. Maybe I just didn't see the correct method or there was a pattern I missed and if that's the case, it's my own dumb fault, but man I love the lack of punishment in all the games! It really gets rid of any sense or urgency or panic that most Hidden Object games have some way of instilling to keep the game play interesting. I've really beat this game into the dust, from it's pointless transition cinematic scenes to the buggy game play, so I want to soften the blows a little and talk about the good for a minute. This is a very simple hidden object game, story and occasional bugs/frustrating controls (How is that possible when you literally just need a left mouse button I have no idea) aside it functions (usually) just like it should. There are some pretty fun puzzles and challenges sprinkled throughout and as a game it does exactly what it claims to do. If you are looking for a fairly cheap and simple game of a Hidden Object variety with some fun puzzles and you honestly don't care much about the story or enjoy getting a laugh out of painfully funny cut scenes and ridiculous reasons for needing to do something, then this game really is perfect for you. I think my disappointment in the game came from the first play through where I was playing for the story, but on my second play through (Which is where I realized nothing is randomized so you can literally memorize the Hidden Object Puzzles and such...yay for zero replay ability part II) I just enjoyed the humor in the game! Like how the protagonist can't lift the lid off a butter dish because it is too oily and absolutely needs a nob for the top of the dish which is missing in the weirdest place ever to lift that incredibly greasy lid, or the fact that you can't push a cart out of the way because it is too heavy, but you can lift it straight up to install a wheel (on your own I might add) so you can roll it out of the way. I could go on and on, but I don't want to spoil all the fun of discovering these insane "reasons" for needing oddly specific items which show up in the most bizarre and unbelievable places. As Hidden Object games go, I did have fun with this one, but the negatives just far outweigh the positives for me so I can't really recommend it, but if you love Hidden Object games and you enjoy a good laugh pick this game up on a sale (I did) and just play through it leisurely. You will enjoy yourself and you'll hit a couple challenging parts which are pretty satisfying to solve. Just don't hold your breath on the story because I have seen five year olds and who can write a more compelling plot and probably animate it at least as well as this game managed. Overall, just sub par compared to many of the Hidden Object games I have played, but fun if you like to pick apart some really weird and confusing stuff.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997740965', 'num_games_owned': 8003, 'num_reviews': 2015, 'playtime_forever': 530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 530, 'last_played': 1568306094}
review:
Приветствую всех и каждого в очередном потоке текста. Довелось пройти спорную по оценкам игру в жанре поиска предметов, которая мне пришлась по душе, что нельзя сказать про подавляющее большинство других игроков, но я склоняюсь к тому, что многие из них впервые обратились в сторону этого жанра, а как вы знаете, друзья, поиск предметов никогда не претендовал на лавры и овации.
И так, товарищи, перед нами Contract With The Devil! Игрушка несомненно средняя, но это присуще всему жанру в целом. Мы имеем внятную сюжетную линию, которая имеет начало и логический конец, так что никаких Вам бесящих to be continued...
Основным развлечением для игрока по классическому наполнению будет...поиск предметов на экране, а еще поиск связанных между собой вещей. Именно на вторую головоломку больше всего помоев вылили обзорщики, но для меня такое поведение осталось тайной. В игре вполне все логично и понятно, но я забываю в каком обществе живу, так что давайте продолжим.
В данной игре есть масса побочных головоломок, но если вы ленитесь их пройти, ну или для вас они слишком сложны, то всегда можно пропустить трудности. С одной стороны это упрощает игру до безобразия, но опять же не будем забывать про контингент нашего любимого магазина.
Очень понравилась продолжительность игрушки. Обычно финальную сцену мы замечаем спустя 2-3 часа после старта игры, а Contract With The Devil дарит игроку от 5 до 8 часов приключений, а еще достижения, карточки и возмутительно низкую цену на скидках. С таким набором достоинств просто грешно ставить отрицательный палец.
Contract With The Devil не претендует занят слот вашей любимой игры, но она прекрасно скрасит промежуток между прохождением ААА гигантов. Хочу поблагодарить всех за отдачу и лайки, берегите нервы и избегайте шлака в магазине.

Если понравился обзор, то приглашаю оценить и остальные: https://steamcommunity.com/id/rrombik/recommended/

review:
I'm pretty surprised this game got mixed reviews, I found it loads more tolerable than most HOGs I've played. Its winning element is probably the visuals, it was definitely well made, the lighting and background were wonderful. Overall, the graphics definitely rival Artifex Mundi games.

The biggest flaw, I have to agree, is the game's functionality. The hit boxes were pretty tight which made tiny objects unclickable, and I found myself accidentally clicking out of the hidden object scene repeatedly. There's also the issue of having difficulty navigating, sometimes you can fail to recognize if a spot can be zoomed in/walked towards, and some inventory items were pretty hard to miss. I also think there was a lot of backtracking towards the end, which a map with fast travel could have helped ease the time consuming trips.

I don't have much issue with the story. It's a fairly standard HOG theme and I didn't find it particularly boring nor interesting. The demons were a nice touch but I wish they could have been utilized a little more to the story.

The puzzles were fun, there were some unique ones I've never played in other games before. It's pretty much a mixed bag of  ridiculously easy, amusing, or downright tedious (anything with rotating jumbled pieces using buttons would drive me up the wall though).

There are a couple glitches in the game as well, sometimes I would experience black screens between two locations and would be forced to restart the game. Restarting always fixes it. There's also the issue of the number in logic matching to be askew with the rest of the sentence.

Overall, it's okay, it's playable (even if I got lost some of the time). It's about 4 hours long and it's time well spent for me. I would definitely recommend this game to anyone who likes HOGs and isn't too fussy about glitches.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969267147', 'num_games_owned': 7582, 'num_reviews': 572, 'playtime_forever': 645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 645, 'last_played': 1560130035}
review:
This is a challenging and quite long casual point-and-click adventure with moderately difficult puzzles and hidden-object scenes. That part is great. Unfortunately, some of the difficulty is due to the gameplay often requiring a frustrating degree of pixel-perfect clicks. Luckily, a walkthrough can help you get past these challenges, but it's very unsatisfying to solve problems this way, especially when you really [I]did[/I] understand the problem logically yourself, but just didn't click on the exact right location.

All things considered, I think this level of pixel-perfect frustration warrants a thumbs down for the game, despite the good things going for it. Did the developers not do any gameplay testing? And really no tester complained about this?

Yet another annoyance: as so many others have pointed out, sometimes the on-screen text goes by far too quickly. Do the developers really not want us to know the game story?!

And if that's not enough: puzzle bugs. I solved the honey puzzle fair and square, but because it wasn't in the predetermined path, it was considered a failure. Seriously?

Achievement tip/bug: the clock resets when you leave a hidden-object scene and come back, so to get the under-one-minute achievement just leave the scene before you click on the last object and come back and click it.

Сразу хочется сказать, что рекомендую эту игру только если вы поклонник данного жанра и игра продается по скидке.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028570547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2563, 'playtime_forever': 678, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 678, 'last_played': 1545158112}
review:
"Contract With The Devil" ist ein klassisches Wimmelbildspiel.

Unsere liebe Tochter Lisa wurde von einer mysteriösen Existenz entführt. Wir müssen uns durch Spiegelwelten rätseln, kleine Gnome besiegen und so manchen Gegenstand finden, um unsere Tochter wieder in die Arme schließen zu können.

Spielmechanisch sind wir im ganz klassischen Wimmelbild-Wahnsinn, in dem es in Screens darum geht, bestimmte Objekte zu finden. Wie meist üblich kommen noch eine große Menge an Schiebe- Kombinations- oder Code-Rätseln hinzu, alles aufgelockert durch wenige kurze Cutscenes.

Das von Mystik nur so triefende Szenario wirkt an einigen Stellen recht bemüht. Daß alles irgendwie mit Magie angefüllt erscheint, scheint doch reichlich an den Haaren herbeigezogen und vor allem deswegen so gebaut, um Logiklöcher möglichst leicht zu stopfen.

Technisch funktioniert das Spiel allerdings gut. Nur zwei Dinge sind etwas schwierig. Die Auflösung ist nicht für große Monitore gemacht, so daß man das Game entweder im Fenster oder unscharf spielen muß. Und die ansonsten gute deutsche Übersetzung hat in seltenen Fällen Ungenauigkeiten (so wird eine normale Nadel mit Faden zum Beispiel als Sicherheitsnadel bezeichnet). Neben diesen Punkten gibt es allerdings technisch nichts zu meckern.

Die Rätsel, oft Schiebe- und Kombinationsrätsel, sind teils einfach, teils auch fordernd, können aber im normalen Modus auch immer übersprungen werden.

Alles in allem ein nicht schlechtes, sehr durchschnittliches Hidden-Object-Spielchen, das sich vor allem an diejenigen richtet, denen die Rätsel wichtiger sind als eine irgendwie logische oder auch nur gut erzählte Geschichte.

[h1]Wertung:[/h1]
6/10 Atmosphäre
4/10 Story
6/10 Grafik
6/10 Sound
6/10 Spielmechanik
6/10 Balancing
6/10 Spielspass

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
Sehr durchschnittliches Wimmelbild-Spielchen.

[h1][b]6/10 Gesamtwertung

Я редко пишу негативные обзоры.
Всегда стараюсь найти плюсы в игре, отношусь с уважением к разработчикам.

- не интуитивное использования предметов, первые локации уже вызывали у меня горение пятой точки. 
- у меня было два ключа и сердце которое нужно открыть было ключом - они подошли? Нет! В дальше хуже, железный ключь открыл золотой замок, а золотой ключ подошёл к железному, и только потом я нашла ключ к сердцу. О да! Ключи не были подписаны. 
- горе перевод предметов - аж два болта в поиске предметов, один из которых болт а другой гайка.а так же нога оказалась куриной лапой. 
- и раздражающие голоса мелких п%@&ков грехов. 
- раздражающая заставка которая сначала меня впечатлила, а потом уже бесила, так как нужно было ждать когда скример сработает. 
- Поиск парных предметов сведёт вас с ума, так как логика их не всегда понятна, половина из всех вещей на экране не кликабельны, а экран застилается туманом каждый три клика.

В общем эту игру я прошла только с 6 раза, бросала её и каждый раз думала, может дальше будет лучше?

К сравнению я сейчас прошла Sacra Terra: Angelic Night, блин ну можно же делать хорошие игры, я прошла штук 50 игр здесь по поиску предметов разных уровней качества и разработчиков, это мой любимый жанр, и эта игра самая раздражающая, и вызывает у меня массу смешанных чувств так как где то качество и ты думаешь вау! author: {'steamid': '76561198120567690', 'num_games_owned': 940, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 478, 'last_played': 1499009601}
review:
[i]Contract with The Devil[/i] is a low-priced hidden object game from a Ukrainian developer with well animated visuals and interesting puzzles offering a promising storyline. Unfortunately the game doesn't know whether it should concentrate on the horror or the cuteness factor (the 2 are kind of mutually exclusive) and there are some bugs present. The game is still good, but could have been much better.

Sonya receives a letter from a person named John McGraw, stating he has some information regarding her daughter. Upon his invitation the mother decides to pay this [strike]strange[/strike] completely normal man a visit, in his mansion. On arrival, she is asked to take a look at - or rather into - a mirror (?), which she does and whoosh, her daughter is taken by a sinister entity. Before the portal closes (because that's what the mirror really is) a leprechaun jumps out (!) of it. He introduces himself as a household spirit (whatever that is) and offers his help in finding and saving Sonya's daughter.
The title pretty much foreshadows what we might expect during our adventure.

The game features some refreshing puzzles (which I prefer in these types of games) - mixed with the usual hidden object scenes - like finding and matching logical pairs (horse - horsehoe, flower - watering can, etc.), some (plenty of) reassembling tasks and creative minigames realted to little demons.
We have to defeat/capture the mentioned 7 little demons representing the 7 deadly sins (however instead of lust and pride, there's anger and power lust for some reason). Finding all 7 of them will take us to many exciting locations, such as an ice world or old places from the past of John McGraw, until the point where we can finally confront the evil antagonist.
The problem with these demons is that their design isn't really scary, but kind of childish looking and it pretty much ruins the general creepy atmosphere of the game. To make things worse they don't speak, but mumble (or I don't even know how to call that sound they make) in a really irritating manner.
Additional story elements and clues can be found on notes, which I always like, so much better than trying to guess 'where should I go, what should I do now?'. Our diary is very useful and does contain information which can help us if we get stuck. As we proceed we'll have the opportunity to watch plenty of cutscenes telling the story of John McGraw and even our own, furthermore of Lisa (our daughter) through flashbacks.

The game has its fair share of bugs: I had to restart (delete the profile and make a new one) the game since it kept on skipping the minigames automatically for no apparent reason at first (2nd time it worked fine though). Occasionally some of the texts are displayed in Ukrainian, despite having played it in English plus there's no voice acting (only in the intro) and the subtitles disappear way too fast sometimes. Another issue is that there are HO scenes where clicking on an object does not always register at first. The game also froze once. It's a shame these aren't fixed, since this is one of the advantages of platforms such as Steam: developers can fix and update their game anytime.

The graphics are nice and atmospheric (for a HOG) with plenty of spooky, outdoor locations and dynamic background elements. Unfortunately the game uses the old 1024x768 standard resolution from the pre-2010 era, so it doesn't look too good on 16:9 screens. The movement of the characters look weird in the cutscenes sometimes, but otherwise they are also well made.

Even though the sound effects are generally good, they appear to be mono, which is a shame since some of the recent HOGs have very good environmental audio. As mentioned, the voice-over only exists in the opening cutscene but even there it's barely audible because the sound effects and the music suppress it.

Despite its flaws (the bugs mostly) [i]Contract with The Devil[/i] is still a pretty good hidden object game with challenging puzzles and fun minigames, so if you like the genre, give it a try and since none of the bugs are game-breaking and a restart always works, they can be overlooked.

PROS
+ nice artwork
+ good puzzles and minigames
+ plenty of cutscenes
+ low price tag for its length

CONS
- a handful of bugs
- atmosphere is killed by the little "demons"
- mono sound, no voice-over
- 1024x768 resolution

RATING
6/10

review:
"Contract With The Devil" to gra typu HOG, zawierająca dwa rodzaje scenek z ukrytymi obiektami. Mamy tutaj klasyczne "znajdź rzeczy z listy" oraz logiczne pary, które polegają na znajdowaniu kombinacji przedmiotów (np. mysz i pułapka na myszy czy klucz i kłódka). Oprócz tego klasycznie co jakiś czas natrafimy na minigrę.

Poziom trudności rozgrywki można określić jako zbalansowany - na scenach z ukrytymi obiektami przedmioty, ktorych szukamy nie odróżniają się od tła, ale wyraźnie je widać. Niektóre minigry mogą stanowić wyzwanie, ale jest też kilka prostych. Tak naprawdę największym wyzwaniem było sterowanie, jeżeli można tak nazwać klikanie w HOG'u. Gra chodzi bardzo topornie. Wiele razy musiałam kilkukrotnie klikać w prawidłowy obiekt w scenie, żeby w końcu go złapać. Co prawda za każdym razem ostatecznie wszystko działało, ale było to dość irytujące. 

Pod względem fabularnym występuje tu ciekawy podział na rozdziały. Zakończenie danego fragmentu rozgrywki stanowi otworzenie portalu z lustra, znajdującego się gdzieś w lokacjach, do których mamy dostęp. Przechodzimy na zmianę między prawdziwym światem, a światem "lustrzanym" w poszukiwaniu kolejnego z siedmiu demonów. Każdy jest manifestacją jednego z grzechów głównych.

Osiągnięcia są raczej standardowe dla tego typu gry - większość odblokujemy po prostu przechodząc całość, pozostałe to ukończenie wszystkich scen z ukrytymi obiektami bez podpowiedzi, rozwiązanie wszystkich minigier bez ich pomijania, znalezienie określonej liczby przedmiotów w określonym czasie itp. Wszystkie można zdobyć w jednej rozgrywce na dowolnym poziomie trudności.

Co tu dużo mówić, mimo problemów z klikaniem gra jest nadal warta polecenia jako całkiem przyjemna, dopracowana produkcja z gatunku HOG.

review:
Where do I begin? 

The game crashed on me repeatedly, and the gliches were just as annoying. If you didn't do something EXACTLY on the spot it wanted, it didn't acknowledge it, leaving to several mistakes and the game penalizing you for "overclicking." Several times, I clicked on the correct objects for HO scenes, and the game never acknowledged it, which led me to play a HO scene for over 20 minutes, looking for something else when I'd already found the correct object. 

In general, there are so many technical irritations and inconveniences that I was annoyed within the first 20 minutes of playing it, and the long cutscenes/animations didn't help as well as some of the puzzles whose logic seemed fair enough, but then took an enormous amount of time to finish. I finished it because of the achievements, but dear lord. This has got to be one of the worst HO games I've ever played, just from the glitches and pickiness of the puzzles alone. 

That being said, the art and animations are pretty, and I recognize this is the first HO game the developer's made, and overall, logistics wise, it was a fine game. Just way too frustrating in regards to glitches and testing my patience repeatedly. If you're looking for a laidback game, I'll go ahead and save you the trouble: this isn't it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043452880', 'num_games_owned': 118, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 871, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1584731369}
review:
On the one hand, this game does have a plot with a degree of mystery to it, and the scenes have a nice mix of obvious and hidden objects. Unfortunately, the game also has some annoying issues. At times, the hit detection suffers; there are also several times where the game forces you to go back and forth because it would not let you pick up an item the first time you were in the area.
The biggest problem, however, lies in two of the gimmicks this game uses. The first is that instead of a simple hidden objects scene, some scenes want you to select logical pairs. Sadly, while all of the pairs do have something in common, there is no similarity between pairs. In one scene you may be required to pair a tool and what the tool works on, two tools, two animals that share the same broad classification, and an animal and a tool that goes with that animal. Between scenes, a flower can go with a vase in one picture but a leaf in another, and while it is true that flowers logically go in vases and flowers and leaves are both logically parts of plants, using both as logical pairs in a puzzle shows a distinct lack of pattern recognition. It wouldn't be so bad if each scene had a similar set of relationships between what you are looking for, but no, instead you must first guess at which objects are clickable and then at which relationship they are looking for - I know that I was disappointed when the picture of fire and the cut logs did not go together since logically cut logs should be burned, .
The second gimmick is in the hidden objects scenes. The first thing to realize is that the entire scene has potential objects in it, despite the artists deliberately setting them to draw the eye to the center. Just because, for instance, you are looking at, say, a painting, doesn't mean that objects are not hidden in the wallpaper outside the frame. No, wait, this is annoying, since the scenes are set up in a way that implies everything is inside a certain area. I'd like to say this is a clever way to play on the players perceptions, but no. This is made even worse by the mist animation used when you make too many mistakes - this mist covers the edges of the screen which implies that everything you are looking fore is towards the center, but no, the mist can in fact cover objects that you are looking for since you need to be looking towards the edges for some items. The other, more important problem, lies in the combination items where two items must first be combined before you can click on it to find it. Some of these are simple - combine a wheel with a wheelless carriage to make a carriage, or combine a fork with a spoon to make cutlery, but they are hampered by bad hit detection. They are also hampered by inconsistent choices in what needs combinations. There are many times when a picture, etching, or drawing of an object counts as that object. This then leads to the question of why some objects that are obvious need combining - there is the potential in one scene to need to first click on scissors, then on the butterfly, in order to cut out the butterfly picture. Again, this would not be too bad if it were not for the other times when a picture counts as the object without any manipulation needed. 
As for the puzzles, they are mostly standard puzzles with skins appropriate to this story. Most of them should be familiar and there was nothing particularly exciting about them. 
As is standard, the replay ability of this game is minimal since while the hidden object scenes do have enough stuff in them that not everything is the same, many of the items will be, and the other puzzles are mostly static.

To conclude, if you are interested in this game you should probably just watch the cut-scenes, then go play a different hidden objects game.

review:
[h1] Don't deal with the devil[/h1]

[i] Contract With The Devil[/i] от студии [i] AZ-Art Development Studio[/i] очень уж сильно напоминает почерк студии [i] Jetdogs Studios[/i]. Игры от этих ребят похожи настолько, что даже плагиатом не назовёшь. Будто у [i] Jetdogs Studios[/i] были какие-то разногласия и одна часть сотрудников ушла и весь 2015 год трудилась под другим именем, а потом как сквозь землю провалилась. [url=kazan.hh.ru/employer/740735] Хотя вакансии в студию имеются [/url], только не упадите с хохоту.

Что первые, что вторые мастера разлагать простую сюжетную историю до уровня сериалов канала «россия 1». Больше в этом пункте даже пояснять ничего не нужно.

В играх, построенных исключительно на поисках предметов и решение головоломок, что первые, что вторые мастера превращать гемпейную часть в пытку. Тут вам и набор глупых действий и глупых решений. Чтобы что-то обычное достать нужно вставить предмет в шкаф, а потом решить головоломку. Причём конкретно у [i] AZ-Art Development Studio[/i] это доходит до настоящего абсурда. Весь этот проклятый дом просто усыпан головоломками. Надо открыть ящик? Найдите сперва ключ, а потом решите головоломку, хотя поблизости имеются необходимые предметы, которые помогли бы добраться до цели менее аккуратно, но значительно быстрее. Помимо классических сцен с поиском предметов добавили сцены с поиском логических пар (например, лук и стрела). Вам нужно найти 12 или 16 предметов, а на экране их чуть ли не 30, а то и больше. Прокликивать всё нельзя. После 4-ех быстрых промахов, на экране появляется туман, который продержится секунды 3-4, и можно продолжать. Кстати, почему-то коса и вилы с чего-то вдруг логически не сочетаются, и таких примеров полно. Но самое главное, что, перебирая весь этот хлам, вы возьмёте совершенно иной предмет. Так, перерыв целую повозку с ширпотребом, мы подберём мехи, которыми разгоним бабочек, ведь ничем другим нельзя прогнать пугливых насекомых, на крайней случай убить. Видимо разработчикам в детстве нравилось ковыряться в бабушкиных шкафах, переполненными всяким хламом былых лет.

Удивительно, но [i] AZ-Art Development[/i] не делали хоррор вставки для самой игры. Зато они их сделали в меню, в итоге нам нужно терпеливо подождать секунд 10, пока дьявол попытается нас напугать, после чего выдаст пункт «продолжить». С таким трюком разработчики запоздали лет 50 так. Что графика, что музыка, что звуки у первых и вторых одинаковы, разве, что у продуктов от [i] Jetdogs Studios[/i] анимация несколько плавнее. Но для тех, кто не привык смотреть, как пытаются заставить дерево шевелиться, это всё будет в виде погрешности.

Если вы где-то застряли, но скорее всего вам ужасно надоел процесс прохождения, то разработчики вам дали возможность пропускать головоломки и использовать подсказки. Но [i] Contract With The Devil[/i] целиком и полностью состоит из этих частей. Т.е. по сути вы пропускаете игру, теряя настроение и время. Поэтому стоит сохранить их и сыграть во что-нибудь более хорошее, чем предавать себя бессмысленным мукам.

review:
The Good
1. A couple of interesting puzzles.

The Meh
1. No voice acting (other than some incomprehensible demon gibberish).
2. Sound levels are inconsistent, there are times I thought my speakers were muted, so I turned the volume up, to be nearly deafened in the next area.
3. Easily forgettable story, characters and plot with the mildly cute and amusing daemons literally being the only saving grace.
4. Lazy animations, an example is at one stage you have to build a boat to get to an island and in the transition animation of the boat rowing to the island, there's no one in the boat.
5. The puzzles are either very easy or rather challenging.

The bad
1. Fixed low resolution, bearable at 1080p (just).
2. Buggy (once had a C++ runtime error crash and another time a black screen loaded with just the hud when transitioning).
3. Hidden object game mistakes, most notable a scalpel was actually a pair of tweezers and a lire was actually a lyre.

There's far better HOG games on offer on steam in this price range and I wouldn't recommend this particular game at full price, @50% off however it's worth a punt.

On a final note, please ignore my play time, I was AFK a lot and I also placed the game twice to make a video walkthrough, in reality, expect about 5 hours play, a little for more for those who struggle with logic puzzles and a little less for seasoned HOG players.

review:
In [b]Contract With The Devil[/b] we take the role of Sonya, a young woman who receives a strange invitation with a promise of revealing something extremely important related to her daughter Lisa.
Sonya quickly wishes she didn't accept such invitation, as the Devil himself appears and kidnaps Lisa, leaving behind a mother in tears but also convinced in bringing her little girl back.

This is the journey of a mother to reunite with her daughter and keep her away from darkness once and for all.
Because of such traverse storyline with an interesting middle twist, we get to enjoy a story tangled between the present and the past. In order to uncover the deepest secrets, Sonya must travel between mirrors, to unveil family secrets, and ultimately undo the contract with the devil that ties her daughter to such events.
With such great story development, we end up spoiled with great visuals across this first game by [i]AZ-Art Development Studio[/i], that bet all in for a fantastic experience.
In-game options are limited, in particular the lack of resolution choices, as limits the visual quality, which is the main focus of Hidden Object games. Other than that, the quality is as good as expected, and due to extreme diversity the game actually offers a solid visual experience.
As gameplay goes, choosing between the system and game's cursor is a nice option, and in-game vsync is on by default, which is good for some users! Puzzles range from easy to medium difficulty, and HoC are available in the traditional system, and an interesting mode in which the objective is to find pairs of objects, without any hints. Not as hard as it seems, and it was a good feature since there aren't that many HoC sequences.
To make the gameplay even more appealing, we get to collect seven little demons, that represents the seven deadly sins, and lock them in a special small box. Ideas like these are exactly what HoC need, more and more!
Audio-voices aren't available, so cutscenes are displayed with just subtitles, but a new language was created for the seven little demons.

Visiting different locations from past and present, dealing with the devil and a cursed offspring, Sonya sure is a mother of courage, and so is young Lisa.
[b]Contract With The Devil[/b] is a great adventure that suits perfectly well for everyone willing to dive in an adventure of the occult, and to help us, we have an interesting leprechaun as a companion who's always ready to give away some hints.
5/10
